name: Jacob's Pickles
address: 680 Columbus Ave, New York, NY 10025, USA

reviews.text: Great apple sangria cocktail. The checkerboard sausage smothered chicken was amazing.

Unique twist on southern style food and special recipes. The fried chicken was thick and juicy. The biscuits are fantastic. The wedge salad was really yummy and I love that they added chicken so it could be my whole meal. The portions are huge so ounce for ounce itâ€™s a great value. You will definitely have leftovers. The service was very friendly. They have too many high tables which many people donâ€™t like to sit at. But the place is huge, so it shouldnâ€™t be hard to get a low table. The music and acoustics are loud. Very few vegetarian items, but you wonâ€™t go hungry. We will definitely be back to try other things on their menu.
Always a great vibe when you eat here at Jacobs Pickles!!! Loved the drinks, appetizers and of course the main dish...we have this as our special time out!
Great food and service.
Some of the yummiest food Iâ€™ve had on the UWS. The servers were kind and friendly and were great about accommodating kids.

We had a party of 4 and wait time was long so I recommend booking a reservation. When they sat us at our table we were missing a chair. When the server brought a chair we noticed the chairs were very worn and used and when you sat on them they wobbled alot we had to ask for another chair and it was still the same.

When it came to service the waiter took a while to get our orders. Now we had to wait a whole 43 min for our food to be served mind you we just had two chicken sandwiches. 2 tables that were seated after us recieved their food first. When asked the wait when the food is coming they said soon. Now when I asked for the check the waiter took 20 min to give us the check I had to ask the host to see whats going on.

In terms of food their old location was much much much better. The place looks all nice and fancy but the service and food was better than in the old location.

Do with this what you will.
The food bar none sets the standard of outdoor dining integrity and taste in food. Amazing staff, food, and drinks. Definitely going again

Food was pretty good but terrible service. Wait staff was annoyed and rude to us. Mean to the kids. Food was pretty good but some things came out cold twice! Overall okay, but disappointed. Rude staff is the worst feeling. Came to celebrate my sons birthday and they ruined it

10/31/25 Update: New flagship location! Still highly recommend. New purpose-built flagship is top notch. Same quality food/menu, perfect vibe/ambiance, solid service, and generous portions. It was a vibrant Halloween night and eponymous owner Jacob was in the house keeping an eye on things.

11/2024: Highly recommend! We have been dining at Jacobâ€™s Pickles since they opened in 2011, and they have been a reliably delicious and fun place to dine (brunch, lunch and dinner!). Doesnâ€™t seem like you can go wrong with anything off their menu but we can personally vouch for the Chicken & Pancakes, Honey Chicken & Pickles, Mushroom Gravy Smothered Chicken, and Hot Chicken Biscuit! Their large house salad is also a great side (delicious dressing!). Generous portions will ensure youâ€™re satisfied and/or have some tasty leftovers to bring home.
Absolutely amazing food and beer! A must to order anything with pickles ofc and a beer too, the bread pudding is also a must.

At Jacobâ€™s Pickles, the food is plentiful whether you have a big appetite or would like to share a plate. We visited their newest location at 680 Columbus Avenue, on the Upper West Side, we had previously went for Brunch at the location on Amsterdam Avenue. My wife and I shared the â€œWestern Cheese Omeletteâ€ and it did not disappoint, plenty of everything in it. Coffee is good and comes with free refills. The atmosphere was loud, if you like quiet, not the place for you even though once, you settle in, you belong. They also have a climate controlled outdoor terrace, great to suck up on the morning Sun. One of the highlights of our visit was the service. The place was packed however, our waitress and bus boy were always attentive and present. Definitely worth a visit, check it out.

â€œEat deliciously"

Super excellent service.. food superbğŸ¥³
Great atmosphere.. sunny and spacious ğŸ˜
Staff pleasant and attentive wowwww
I was really impressed ğŸ¥³ğŸ˜‹ğŸ¥³ğŸ˜‹ğŸ¥³
Portions were enormous and affordable which is very rare! Five stars

I recently visited the new location, and it was fantastic. Here are my updated thoughts since my last visit.

The service was outstanding. I attended a private event after enjoying happy hour, which offered plentiful food and drink options. I highly recommend the Mini Manhattan flight: fun, flavorful, and beautifully presented. The regular and happy hour menu caters equally well to vegetarians and meat eaters, with every dish prepared to perfection. Despite handling a full bar, restaurant, and our event simultaneously, the staff remained attentive, organized, and gracious throughout.

I wonâ€™t wait another five years to return.

Review from 5 years ago:
Great vibe, food, drinks and service. Jacobs Pickles will not disappoint. They have unique and traditional dishes. A surprisingly great array of food for both meat lovers and vegetarians.
From the South. Pickle freak. Can verify this place is legitimate and delicious.

A little farther north than I usually like to go, but we had a fun dinner at the new (bigger and brighter) location of Jacob's Pickles.

Let's start with the food: get a pickle flight.  All four we got were good and the standouts were the horseradish cukes and the green beans. We also got the poutine (ok - definitely needed more gravy); classic mac and cheese (fine) and the honey chicken on a biscuit (chicken was delicious, biscuit was good and the grits on the side were unnecessary). In general, food was solid and deserved about 4 stars.

What brought the rating to five was our server Mason. The perfect mix of friendly and attentive and leave diners alone to enjoy their meals.  One of the best servers I have met in a while.

Tables were pretty close so our neighbors almost felt like they were a part of my dinner party.

Outstanding Service from Jason!
Our waiter Jason was absolutely amazing, he truly made our night! We came in after having a pretty rough day, but his kindness, professionalism, and upbeat attitude completely turned it around. He went above and beyond to make sure everything was perfect, and his positive energy made our experience unforgettable. Thanks to Jason, our bad day became a blur, and we left with smiles and a great memory. Weâ€™ll definitely be coming back because of him!
Very loud restaurant, but food and service are very good.

Ordered the Buttermilk chicken Caesar salad from wonder. But I did pick up when I went to pick up my order. I was told that they're not accepting any orders from any online food apps. The young man was very spicy. His lip gloss was poppin'. Another young lady came out wanted to look at my food app to see what I ordered and where I order it from long story short, the food was delish.Once I got home, but they need to get it together.When it comes to these food apps

They moved! To a much bigger and nicer place
680 Columbus Ave.

The best comfort food in the upper west side!
Donâ€™t go if you are on a diet, huge delicious portions that you canâ€™t stop eating!

Excellent Southern cooking. Gotta love Jacob's Pickles-- their comfort food, service, and quality, plus the size of portions are outstanding!
UPDATE: I heard that Jacob's Pickles was closed due to violations of a New York City health inspection??

This place has a big great menu to choose.
The food is delicious every bite hits the spot.
I love the ambiance it  is so beautiful.
And the service is top notch!! Joha the server that took care of my table was very kind and answered any questions I had. She created a really nice experience!
Definitely recommend this place!
The food was amazing!!

Food is great as always. Service was fine, especially the folks who actually bring the food, though I could have done without the   â€œguysâ€ from our server.

I really donâ€™t want to go back, unfortunately, as I love the food. Why? Because the â€œmusicâ€ is really just too loud, whether itâ€™s trance or some other frenetic genre. Iâ€™ve never understood why it has to be this loud at the former location and am very disappointed to find it as such at the new one.

Updated: their new location is really good, spacious, and wonderful interiors. This place continues to be busy! We tried their delicious Matzo Ball Soup this time, and deviled eggs. Both were fantastic.

Our server James was excellent who ensured we had a pleasant experience during our time here.

Older review: After a walk-in waiting list fiasco (they got our number wrong) and waiting for over 40 mins, we got seated in a rather packed corner with fairly limited space to sit comfortably. We couldn't blame the table behind us either, because they definitely needed that extra space.

Jordan, our server, got us straight to ordering; A freshly squeezed lemonade, Biscuits Gravy & Eggs ($16), Classic Mac & Cheese ($18), Hot Chicken Biscuit ($22), and Okra & Chiles ($13).

It's your typical American comfort food; giant portions and good for a once in 6-months kindda meal - extremely tasty though! For the health conscious person, sharing an appetizer and entree would make perfect sense.

For the Hot Chicken Biscuit plate, it would've been nice if both pieces of chicken had the Nashville Hot Sauce on top. Only one piece had a generous pour, so the other one felt pretty bland!

Jordan was attentive all throughout, and service overall was quick. Food arrived within 15 mins of placing our order. Noise levels were on the higher end and was pretty difficult to have a conversation without raising your voice around 2 pm on a spring Saturday!

We might drop by for a drink or two the next time, and to order their Okra & Chiles again which was really pickled!

Great selection of pickles (and other food!). Mac and cheese, fried chicken Caesar salad, hot chicken sandwich, deviled eggs, cheesy grits, and fried Oreos were delicious. Horseradish and kosher dill were the favorite pickles. Service was quick, attentive, and effective. Atmosphere was relaxed, will return with our children on our next trip.

Love the new location, much bigger and brighter. Everything is great, the season pumpkin biscuits and pumpkin bread pudding is a must. Only one caveat - they no longer have my favorite chicken and pancakeğŸ¥² please bring it back!!

This is a brand new location on the Upper West Side and itâ€™s better than ever! Jacob has really outdone himself with this spot. Itâ€™s big, spacious, beautifully decorated, and has such a warm, lively vibe. The service was just amazing; our server, Arielle, did a fantastic job helping us with menu selections and pairing dishes perfectly.

We started with the Pick-4-Pickles...a must-try! The Candy Beets took me by surprise with how good they were. The Hot Sour Pickles were bold and flavorful, the Big Dill Culture Pickles were crisp and classic, and the Sweet & Spicy Carrots were absolutely delicious. All that flavor for such a great price!

For drinks, both the non-alcoholic and alcoholic options were great. The Jacobâ€™s Pickles Biscuit Beer was incredible... it paired beautifully with the Honey Chicken & Biscuit meal that came with cheesy grits (which were to die for).

We also had the Buffalo Chicken Mac & Cheese: extra cheesy, creamy, and full of flavor. And as a self-proclaimed French fry lover, I have to say..... these fries were amazing! Perfectly crispy on the outside, soft inside, and seasoned just right.

Everything that came out of the kitchen looked beautiful. Honestly, you almost donâ€™t want to eat it because of how pretty the presentation is. But the smell and aroma of the food make it impossible to resist.

The ambiance is great... perfect for talking, relaxing, and enjoying THE GREAT food selections. Even the washrooms were spotless (which always says a lot about a restaurant).

Iâ€™d definitely recommend making a reservation, because this place is already a hot spot on the Upper West Side.

Highly recommend Jacobâ€™s Pickles and Iâ€™ll definitely be coming back. Itâ€™s officially a new favorite.

Went for a late lunch, wanted light b/c of dinner plans. I had white bean hummus with pickled crudite and corn chips - absolutely perfect! Wait staff super attentive and friendly, atmosphere warm and welcoming. Would definitely go again.

Jfk T5 location
Takes forever to make your order. Took around 38 mins to make a burger. Do not order from here unless you got more than an hour until your flight. Early morning and location was only 1/3 full.
Food was mediocre,  got their breakfast burger.
Delicious food, huge portions, and really great service!
This is my go place for Southern food in Manhattan.

After walking by Jacobâ€™s Pickles every time I went grocery shopping, I finally got the chance to go in this weekend. It was a food extravaganza!! Our server was Joha. She was so kind, provided amazing recommendations, and kept coming back to check on us! She was so friendly. The food was AMAZING. My friend and I split the pickle smallerâ€¦ the pickled beets were interestingâ€¦ almost like a candle. The bread and butter pickles were the perfect amount of sweet and tart. Huge fan of them!! I got the classic chicken biscuit, which was made to perfection. The chicken was glazed and almost a bit caramelized with honey, not too sweet but so perfect. It made amazing leftovers as well. I was so happy with this meal and will definitely be back, when I can afford it. THANK YOU JOHA AND THANK YOU JACOBâ€™S PICKLES!

Maybe in 2018 this was a great spot but in 2025 it felt like it could be any other American restaurant (if someone told me I was at The Smith I wouldâ€™ve believed them). Staff is friendly but damn they are running around because even on a Sunday night this place is BUSY.

Food was very hit or miss. Pickles were great but the biscuits and grits would have been sent back if served at any real southern restaurant. We loved the fried chicken. All in all, Iâ€™d say Jacobâ€™s Pickles has lost its special sauce but hoards of other diners coming in, even during non brunch hours, would tell me Iâ€™m wrong. ğŸ¤·â€â™€ï¸

Fabulous dinner! They food was delicious,  true comfort food. We had the chicken with mushroom gravy, the salmon burger and the sausage and biscuits. Fresh, rich and delicious. Big portions, you will most likely have leftovers. Great experience, wish they had locations in other states :) so delicious!

The food is delicious! Although, the cocktails tasted way better in the old location. But the service is terrible! I understand, it is probably super busy right now, but nonetheless. Hope it will get improved

Update September 2025
The food is still has good as I remember it! This is the best crispy chicken I have ever had! We made a reservation. We had a big group. And by 3:00 they were out of chicken sandwiches and asparagus.
Itâ€™s also very loud. Food is still 10/5.
This was also at the new location.

May 2021
Uh...10/10!! I would say this is my favorite restaurant in the city. Everything we ordered was delicious. I highly recommend the BBQ chicken sandwich AND the classic mac and cheese. The service was amazing!! It really is as good as people say it is.
Meh.

I absolutely want to give a huge shout out to Reagan and the rest of thr crew at Jacob's Pickle... as kids, we know how picky our parent's can be lol and my mother is that way when it comes to spicy foods, she has a sensitive palate lol. Despite the multiple attempts to accommodate her, things just didn't truly work out ... and Reagan went above and beyond, as well as the owner! Who actually came to our table to personally check on us. EVERYTHING about this spot blew me away and I will absolutely return again and again and again. Thanks everyone, I definitely appreciate your hard work.
Excelent services ! Joha is the best
Joha was amazing, good food
Great new location.  Food was great as always.  The ambiance was amazing  however,  the staff was almost rushing us to eat and leave when there seemed like there was plenty of open tables.
Amazing driving and chicken! Can't say enough. Great experience. Would definitely make a reservation if you're going on the weekend.
We had a lovely evening at Jacobâ€™s Pickles!! Our server Joha was wonderful. We will be back!!

Excited to come for lunch for family visiting, and to try the new UWS locationâ€” vibe of the space is great, however it doesnâ€™t seem like the team working can handle the new amount of covers. Restaurant was about 2/3rds full for Friday lunch, but our food took over an hour for three people, and our server seemed extremely unprepared in regards to the menu (seemed like she was new/ major lack of effective training)â€” multiple food and drink items were out on the menu but werenâ€™t informed until we were ordering, and even the soup of the day was different than what we were told and the server never addressed it until after it hit the table. Fries were cold which made us believe the food had been waiting a while to be run, but otherwise the food tasted good.
Overall disappointing visit, but I have enjoyed coming in the past, not sure if Iâ€™ll come again.
Amazing place, excellent food and service.
Loved this place! I love Southern food, so generous and tasty. Ordered a Southern BLT, and it was huge. Honestly couldn't finish it all.

Do you want to feel like youâ€™re eating a massive, indulgent brunch while satisfying both your sweet and savory cravings? This is it. Perfectly crispy fried chicken meets thick, custardy French toast  and trust me, drizzle it with the hot honey instead of syrup. The flavor pops in a way that makes every bite feel special.

Quick notes for fellow diners:

Service: Exceptionally friendly and charming.

Wait time: Barely any. We were seated faster than expected.

Food: Pickles? Perfect. Exactly the right snap and tang.

Atmosphere: Clean, cozy, and the outdoor area is surprisingly spacious for NYC.

If youâ€™re visiting the city or just need a hearty brunch that hits every craving, Jacobâ€™s Pickles absolutely delivers.

Pros:
- was sat down straightaway at the bar
- the food was perfectly cooked
- great service (I just wanted to try one fried pickle instead of a whole portion and they accomodated that)
- they had restroom staff who kept everything clean and orderly as they were mixed stalls

Cons:
- Iâ€™m from the UK and the portion is too big ğŸ˜‚ loads of food waste at the restaurant (but they had takeout boxes so thank you)
Blake  the manager and the staff are very professional. Looking forward to a new location next to Trader Joeâ€™s at 92nd  and Columbus.

First time here and I thought it was great. The food was good , the chicken sandwiches were stacked!!! Definitely need a fork and knife just to eat it.  Over all the chicken sandwiches were delicious and filling . Honestly I couldn't finish it  . The biscuit it self wasn't all that. Mac and cheese was wowğŸ‘Œdefinitely a most !! Cheesey and creamy. And last fried pickles it was ehhh it could be better. The Service was excellent. I would definitely come back .

This place was recommended to me by friends, so I was really looking forward to visiting. I wanted to give it five stars, but we fell just a little short. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and the ambience was lively. We sat outside, which was enjoyable, though we did have to deal with a bit of direct sunlight.

The highlights for us were the fried pickles and the croque madameâ€”both delicious, and the portions were huge (easily enough for two people). On the other hand, my drink and the gravy dish we tried were less impressive.

Overall, though, Iâ€™d certainly recommend giving Jacobâ€™s Pickles a try. Itâ€™s a fun spot with hearty portions and great service.

I have been wanting to try this spot for awhile so I was so pleased when I was in the area and able to snag a table early Saturday evening. I tried the cornbread, the okra, catfish tacos and the seasonal pumpkin biscuit beer. The beer was honestly the highlight of the meal, I seriously loved it so much. The okra was an incredible dish- I have only ever had deep fried okra and honestly didnâ€™t know that there were other ways to prepare it but WOW. The seasoning was perfection and apparently the okra was pickled before itâ€™s cooked which I think really evevates the flavors and yet it wasnâ€™t too salty. It was cooked to the point of being a bit caremelized and crispy. Truly delicious. The only thing Iâ€™d say is it was a touch too oily for my tastes. And donâ€™t get me wrong I am from the south so I get it, but to a point the extra oil becomes unnecessary. The cornbread was delicious and felt extremely gluttonous between the butter and cheese (thatâ€™s a good thing). I canâ€™t say Iâ€™d recommend the catfish tacos but I would definitely go back to try something else. Not sure how the catfish was prepared but I have only ever had deep fried catfish and thatâ€™s how I prefer it and was expecting that type of more fluffy catfish thatâ€™s crispy on the outside. That was not the type of catfish thatâ€™s crispy was on these tacos, so they werenâ€™t my favorite. I will say the portions are very generous- Iâ€™d want to come back with at least a few friends next time so weâ€™re able to try more dishes! These three were more than enough for my friend and I. I also have to give props to the server, wish I got her name but she was awesome and everybody working there was really friendly. I hope to try it again next time Iâ€™m in the upper west side

Located in the Upper West Side, this southern food restaurant was a good surprise! Service was very friendly and plate size were really big! They have a terrace on Amsterdam St which is nice during the summer. I had the buffalo mac & cheese and I wasnâ€™t disappointed! Loved it!

Absolutely loved this place! The staff were incredibly friendly and welcoming, making us feel right at home from the moment we walked in. The food was absolutely delicious . The portions were generous. Highly recommend this restaurant for anyone looking for great food, great service, and a great atmosphere!

Friends told me that this spot is known for its breakfast and brunch/lunch, especially the variety of egg dishes and their bread. To really evaluate a place, I think itâ€™s important to start with a classic meal, so we ordered the traditional breakfast. Eggs: one plate with sausage and another with bacon. The portions were generous, and the eggs were excellent, cooked just right and full of flavor. Where the experience fell short was the bread. It was highlighted on the menu, so expectations were high. Unfortunately, it was underwhelming :( tasteless, and a little dry. Honestly, a simple slice of fresh ciabatta or sourdough would have elevated the whole plate.
On the brighter side, the cocktail I tried was delicious, and the service was outstanding. Our server was warm, professional, and genuinely joyful <3 , which added a lot to the experience. The atmosphere is also a big plus: lively, welcoming, and clearly a place where guests leave satisfied.
Would I come back? Probably, but next time Iâ€™d skip the bread and try something different.

The only redeeming qualityâ€”if you could call it thatâ€”of this place is the flavor of its food. Everything else, though, it severely misses the mark. From the moment we stepped in, the atmosphere was flooded with the constant clinking of bar glasses, the booming chatter that restricted any conversation, the crowded, small tables and the dim lights that made it so we could barely see our food. The whole place was crowded and loud. We were seated, and we ordered our food and drinks. The drinks arrived first, and severely missed the mark. The root beer had a mild taste of toothpaste, and the watermelon beer was nearly undrinkable. Then, our appetizers arrived. They had insane quantities of food, and looked more like entrees than appetizers. Itâ€™s almost like they designed all their food to be wasted. The taste was decent, with the fried pickles being greasy but manageable, the cornbread more reminiscent of a cornbread pizza than actual cornbread, and the green tomatoes being thick and slightly under seasoned. After a long time of waiting, our entrees arrived. The quantities were so unimaginably huge that I got sick just looking at the dishes. I mean, how much calories must be in every dish?? they gave us no warning on the huge quantities, making us order way too much food! Speaking of food, similarly to the appetizers, it was decent. The chicken and waffles was MASSIVE, with three French toasts stacked and two massive pieces of chicken. If you call that â€œgenerous portions,â€ thatâ€™s fine, but to me, thatâ€™s â€œridiculous portions.â€ Simply way too much. The chicken was moist and juicy, probably the best food the whole meal, while the French toast was dense and cakey. The meatloaf was decent, but it was very beefy, and the sheer quantity caused us to waste a lot of the food. Overall, very disappointing experience. Do better Jacobâ€™s pickles!! You have so much potential!!

Loved everything about this place. Perfect for a casual brunch in the city to meet with friends or have a nice meal with a family. Portions are generous and meals are so delicious! The service is outstanding, greatly appreciated!

This place is an experience worth having. The food was very tasty and plentiful. The lemonade could have been larger, but the service was great. If you love bacon then the steak bacon is a must try. Thank me later.

The slow customer service, coupled with substandard food and beverages, left us with a highly unfavorable overall impression. I neither recommend nor would I revisit this establishment. The staff appeared disinterested in our feedback, as they never asked about our satisfaction. Although the server recommended the meatloaf, my guest and I agreed it was the worst we had ever encountered.

Had not been to Jacobâ€™s Pickles in maybe 15 years and back then I wasnâ€™t quite in the mindset to fully appreciate the food .

This time I came back with a friend for lunch and was impressed by the cozy vibe, great service, and delicious food. I had a house beer along with the patty melt burger, and we ordered the endive nachos for the table. All were delicious. Will definitely be back when in the area again!

WOW! The pictures really donâ€™t do justice to the generous potions or delicious textures of the food here.

We got the chicken salad and the beef ribs. Both were spectacular and reasonably priced. The chicken was perfectly crispy and light, while the ribs had a hint of sweetness that set them apart.

The service is wonderful as well. Our server was extremely kind and attentive.

The only thing I didnâ€™t love about this place was that they packed a lot of people into such a small place, making it quite loud inside.
Southern specialties. Buttermilk fried chicken. High quality price ratio. Huge quantity. For 4 people, order 3 main but they offer doggy bag. Fried chicken is just so good!

What a wonderful and filling experience. Every plate that hit our table was the perfect temperature, very warm yet not too hot to eat as well as perfectly presented. Possibly the best fried pickles Iâ€™ve had, theyâ€™re battered in something similar to hush puppies as opposed to just breaded like most places. Absolutely enormous deviled eggs. Our sandwiches were massive as was the mac & cheese. We 100% needed boxes to take all our food home. I wish I didnâ€™t get so full so I could continue eating. Canâ€™t wait to find out what dessert is like but it was impossible to fathom today. The restaurant itself is designed with such a great vibe and aesthetic. Our server, Jordan, was lovely, polite and prompt, an absolute delight to have help us. Impeccable service. I canâ€™t sing his praises enough. Not only all of this, but the music was a vibe. Every song was a hit and at various points I was dancing a little while eating. Whomever made this playlist has amazing taste. Theyâ€™re moving but Iâ€™ll definitely be hunting this place down at their new location.

Iâ€™ve heard about this place since I moved to nyc. Itâ€™s been on my list for a long time. I got the idea to go for restaurant week. - however do not be fooled! The restaurant week deal is not a deal at all - we ordered separately and spent less.

The food - the portions are large and delicious. We got the entire pickle flight which was a lot but we were so happy with all of them.  Also got the burger and chicken sandwich and non of them let me down. All stand true to the company and brand.

The grits were my least fav but I still ate all of them.

The staff and atmosphere are amazing and the vibe is nice. On my cheat days Iâ€™ll go back cus nothing I ate was anywhere near healthy. But it was very enjoyable

Great place! The owner was very kind and surprised us with a birthday cake (on the house). Special dishes and easy to find parking nearby. All stuff was very kind. The place was recommended by Chat GPT.

One of my favorite restaurants while visiting nyc! Everything was cooked perfectly and seasoned well. The Buffalo Mac and Cheese was amazing!

The service was decent but when it gets busy and chaotic they seem to be a little disorganized. We didnâ€™t even know who our server/waiter was because a few different guys would come back to check on us back and forth.

Best Fried Chicken you can get in NYC. Crispy, Juicy, Lighted Breaded, and has good flavor. Overall, itâ€™s amazing Southern Food Cooking and the most important thing is - the food is LIGHT - light for southern cooking! Itâ€™s super tasty and all the pickles are amazing. The Sausage Gravy is also noteworthy, youâ€™d think it would weigh you down but it actually lifts you up. I always get the Hot Chicken Biscuit Sandwich and it never disappoints. The portions are HUGE so watch out. Iâ€™ve been a couple of times and have gotten the Poutine, Mac & Cheese, All the Pickles, The Cornbread, and more - Itâ€™s all good. Youâ€™ll have a great time here as it is always busy and the atmosphere is great. Highly Recommend, I am a repeat customer for life.
I really liked this restaurant! The food was delicious and everything tasted fresh. Great flavors and generous portions.

My wife had mentioned Jacobâ€™s Pickles to me so many times. She and her coworker used to frequent the spot, always coming home with deli containers full of green beans and carrots. They were pretty good. Had some heat, which I like.

Iâ€™ve been here a few times now, and this place gets packed fast. Definitely come with a reservation. They even call ahead to check if youâ€™re still coming.

All the food portions are huge. Iâ€™ve never left empty handed. The smashed burger is my go-to. Itâ€™s messy, rich, and hits every single time.

The pickles are absolutely delicious. The chicken sandwich was crispy and flavorful. The grits was delicious too, the food here does not disappoint. The restaurant has a cute bar feel to it. It has itâ€™s busy times so be prepared to wait for a table. The staff is friendly.

Our go to place before a show at the Beacon, it's a far enough walk  to work off the enormous portions of comfort food done right. They are moving about 10 blocks north but it will still be our spot for the  Upper West side.  Stand out dishes for me Nashville hot chicken, slab bacon and street corn

This place makes some decent chicken and biscuits with ok sauces, and excessive pickles (which Iâ€™m saying as a pickle lover) to the point on drenching the breading on the chicken and the biscuit underneath.

It was also a bit hard to flag down staff when we wanted to pay and leave. Iâ€™ll likely come back again (and will ask for pickles on the side).

First thing to note, the portions are absolutely massive. We ordered two dishes between us and couldn't finish it. The food was served super quickly after we placed our order, but it was so quick that things weren't reheated sufficiently. The chicken in the sausage gravy chicken biscuits were lukewarm with no crunch on the batter. The gravy and grits were both also not hot. It felt like a good intro to Southern food in Manhattan, but I suspect there are other better options in the city. Food critique aside, the staff were knowledgable, friendly and made the whole experience.

Jacobâ€™s Pickles has been one of my go-to spots for special brunches with friends and family over the years. The environment is cozy, yet elevated, and Iâ€™m yet to have a bad experience.

My favorite is the hot chicken biscuit. The combination of the rich biscuit, crunchy chicken, hot sauce, and pickles is simple, but a total flavor explosion. For brunch, Iâ€™m also a fan of the maple chicken and toast. You get 3 huge portions of French toast that comes with 2 huge pieces of chicken.

If you have a few people, donâ€™t skip whatever the bread pudding special of the day is. Trust me on this oneâ€¦.

One tip is to be prepared for HUGE portion sizes. Youâ€™ll want to try everything on the menuâ€¦ but this isnâ€™t a place to over order!
Excellent food and service with very generous portions. Would def recommend if you're looking for a delicious, filling meal.

During our New York City trip, I kept hearing glowing reviews about Jacobâ€™s Pickles, so I knew it had to be on our must-visit list. We arrived around noon on a Wednesday and were promptly seated. My husband went for the specialâ€”Oreo Biscuit French Toastâ€”while I chose the Maple Chicken and Toast. Both dishes were absolutely outstanding. The portions were so generous that we had more than enough to share, and my son eagerly sampled both of our meals, with plenty of leftovers to spare. If only our hotel had a microwave, I wouldâ€™ve loved to take the leftovers back to enjoy later! The staff, including our server, were incredibly friendly and attentive, which made the experience even more delightful. Iâ€™m already looking forward to returning to try other tempting dishes like the poutine, buffalo mac 'n' cheese, and fried Oreos. My advice to anyone visiting is to come hungryâ€”the portions are massive, and the menu is filled with mouthwatering options that will definitely leave you satisfied!
